channel.title: CyberNetSec - Policy and Compliance
channel.description: Latest policy and compliance threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: U.S. Finalizes Ban on Chinese and Russian Tech in Connected Vehicles, Forcing Massive Supply Chain Overhaul
item.description:
The United States has finalized new regulations from the Commerce Department that will ban hardware and software from China and Russia in connected vehicles sold in the U.S. The rules are designed to mitigate national security risks, preventing foreign adversaries from collecting sensitive data or m...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Issues Directive Forcing Removal of Unsupported Edge Devices from Federal Networks
item.description:
In response to increasing exploitation by nation-state actors, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has issued Binding Operational Directive (BOD) 26-02. The directive mandates that all Federal Civilian Executive Branch (FCEB) agencies inventory and remove all unsupported...

Severity: High

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Microsoft Mandates TLS 1.2 for Azure Blob Storage, Sunsetting Older Versions
item.description:
Microsoft has officially deprecated support for Transport Layer Security (TLS) versions 1.0 and 1.1 for its Azure Blob Storage service, effective February 3, 2026. TLS 1.2 is now the minimum required version for all new and existing blob storage accounts across all Azure clouds. This mandatory secur...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: UK Advances New Bill to Regulate Managed Service Providers (MSPs)
item.description:
The United Kingdom government is advancing a new Cyber Security and Resilience Bill aimed at strengthening the nation's digital supply chain. A key provision of the bill is to bring Managed Service Providers (MSPs) under direct regulatory oversight for the first time. Citing the systemic risk demons...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Criticized for Silently Updating KEV Catalog with Ransomware Data
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) is facing criticism for its practice of silently updating its Known Exploited Vulnerability (KEV) catalog. In 2025, the agency updated 59 entries to indicate that the flaws were being used in ransomware attacks, but it did not issue an...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Threat Intelligence, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: UK Law Criminalizing AI-Generated Deepfake Intimate Images Takes Effect
item.description:
A new law in the United Kingdom is set to come into force on February 6, 2026, making it a criminal offense to create or share AI-generated 'deepfake' intimate images of an adult without their consent. The law, part of the Data (Use and Access) Act 2025, amends the Sexual Offences Act 2003 to specif...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: FCC Warns Telecoms of 4x Increase in Ransomware, Urges Better Security
item.description:
The U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has issued a formal alert to the telecommunications industry regarding the escalating threat of ransomware. Citing data that shows a fourfold increase in attacks on the sector between 2022 and 2025, the FCC's Public Safety and Homeland Security Bureau...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Ransomware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Health-ISAC Report: AI-Enabled Attacks Named Top Threat to Healthcare Sector in 2026
item.description:
The Health Information Sharing and Analysis Center (Health-ISAC) has released its 2026 Global Health Sector Threat Landscape report, identifying AI-enabled attacks as the number one projected concern for the year. Based on surveys of healthcare executives and security professionals, the report highl...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Policy and Compliance, Ransomware

item.title: UStrive Mentoring Platform Exposes Data of 238,000 Users, Including Minors, via Leaky API
item.description:
The non-profit mentoring platform UStrive has inadvertently exposed the sensitive personal data of over 238,000 users due to a misconfigured GraphQL API endpoint. A significant portion of the exposed user base includes minors, elevating the severity and privacy implications of the incident. The leak...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Policy and Compliance, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cybersecurity Risks Mount as Partial US Government Shutdown Begins
item.description:
A partial U.S. government shutdown began at midnight on January 31, 2026, after funding for several federal agencies, including the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), lapsed. Security experts are warning that such shutdowns create a period of heightened cybersecurity risk for the nation. With re...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence
